thread.title: "The Voice" Recap: Steals by Adam, Gwen, Blake
thread.title_full: "The Voice" Recap: Steals by Adam, Gwen, Blake

title: "The Voice" Recap: Steals by Adam, Gwen, Blake
text:
"The Voice" Recap: Steals by Adam, Gwen, Blake Posted just a moment ago 
Trae Patton/NBC (LOS ANGELES) -- The second week of the battle rounds got under way on The Voice Monday night. Coaches Adam Levine,Blake Shelton, Gwen Stefani and Pharrell Williams continued to pair up their artists for an elimination-style singing duel. 
During the two-hour episode, Adam, Gwen and Blake each stole one artist. 
We again saw appearances during rehearsals by mentors Selena Gomez (Team Gwen), John Fogerty(Team Adam), Brad Paisley (Team Blake) and Missy Elliott (Team Pharrell). 
A pair of Team Blake artists got the night started: Blaine Mitchell and Blind Joe. They were assigned Bob Seger’s "Old Time Rock and Roll." 
Pharrell praised Blaine for hitting a high note, but sided with Blind Joe. Gwen commended Blaine for having to command the stage on his own, with Blind Joe sitting during the performance. Blake chose Blind Joe as the winner, saying there's something special about him. Adam swooped in and stole Blaine. 
Cassandra Robertson and Viktor Király went head-to-head for Team Adam, singing The Tony Rich Project's "Nobody Knows." 
The judges were complimentary of Cassandra. Adam noted how well they connected with one another on stage. He added that neither of them could have done better. He declared Viktor the winner. Cassandra was eliminated. 
Next, Team Gwen's Chase Kerby and Korin Bukowski did battle with one another. Their coach gave them Regina Spektor's "Samson." 
Pharrell didn't think the song was in Chase's wheelhouse. It appeared he favored Korin. Gwen said music is about emotion, and there was nothing more emotional than her artists' performance. Korin moves on, and Chase goes home. 
Evan McKeel and Riley Biederer took the stage together for Team Pharrell. They covered Stevie Wonder's "Higher Ground." 
Adam leaned towards Evan. Blake agreed that Evan won the battle, though he felt Riley has the more unique sound. Pharrell picked Evan, while Gwen stole Riley. 
Braiden Sunshine was matched with Team Gwen teammate Lyndsey Elm. They tackled Howard Jones' “No One Else to Blame.” 
Adam said they were both excellent, but in different ways. Blake said it would be a tough decision, suggesting to Gwen that she flip a coin. Gwen selected Braiden as the winner, calling him a "diamond in the rough." Lyndsey is out of the competition. 
For the final battle of the night, twin sisters Andi & Alex battled Chance Peña for Team Adam. They performed The Calling’s "Wherever You Will Go." 
Blake said the collaboration was "magical." Gwen offered similar praise. Adam suggested that the three of them should form a group. He added that this was the hardest decision he's had to make on the show. He kept Andi & Alex, but Blake stole Chance. 
NBC will air more battles Tuesday night at 9 p.m. Eastern time.
